intro: Castilleja pallida var. lutescens, commonly known as the yellow paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange-red bract-like flowers. The plant has reduced leaves and relies on host plants for water and nutrients, making it a partial parasite. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
